questions.question: What is singleton scope?
questions.ans1: This scopes the bean definition to a single instance per Spring IoC container
questions.ans2: This scopes the bean definition to a single instance per HTTP Request
questions.ans3: This scopes the bean definition to a single instance per HTTP Session
questions.ans4: This scopes the bean definition to a single instance per HTTP Application/ Global session

questions.question: What is true about <map> collection configuration elements?
questions.ans1: This helps in wiring a list of values, allowing duplicates
questions.ans2: This helps in wiring a list of values but without any duplicates
questions.ans3: This can be used to inject a collection of name-value pairs where name and value can be of any type

questions.question: What is byType mode of autowiring?
questions.ans1: Default setting which meas no autowiring and you should use explicit bean reference for wiring
questions.ans2: Autowiring by property name. Spring tries to match and wire its properties with the beans defined by the same names in the configuration file
questions.ans3: Spring first tries to wire using autowire by constructor, if it does not work, Spring tries to autowire by byType
questions.ans4: Autowiring by property type. Spring tries to match and wire a property if its type matches with exactly one of the beans name in configuration file

questions.question: What is Join point?
questions.ans1: This represents a point in your application which joins two objects
questions.ans2: This represents a point in your object where you join values
questions.ans3: This represents a point in your object where you join injected values
questions.ans4: This represents a point in your application where you can plug-in AOP aspect.

questions.question: What are the different points where weaving can be applied?
questions.ans4: Compile time, load Time, Run time

questions.question: How to use ref keyword in beans ?
questions.ans3: Using setter method and constructor argument both

questions.question: Can we integrate Struts with Spring ?
A bean must have id attribute in beans configuration file
